data.text: @Spain_inUK Does the PCR test for 12-17 year olds have to be a a clinic test or is a home kit result accepted ?

@Spain_inUK Can an unjabbed person infected in November 2021, with an antibody certificate from Lloyds Doctors Online from December, but without proof of a +ve PCR test, get in? The guidance on Spain's site says the immunity certificate must be accompanied by proof of the positive test ...
@Spain_inUK Why can 12-17 year old provide a negative test but not every age group. Makes no sense 🤬

@angiebabe1961 yes you do. As detailed on the link, prior to travelling to Spain, all passengers must also present a QR code which is obtained from filling in the Health Control Form (FCS in Spanish) available via Spain Travel Health (SpTH).
@angiebabe1961 @Spain_inUK Just checked the link and the passenger locator form is still required. I'm back in May, then Oct...so will be keeping track!
@Davecram2 You'll find all the details on here: https://t.co/dnBIGGiZ0v
@Spain_inUK Hi @Spain_inUK where do I get a covid recovery form? I am double jabbed but over my 270 days and will not be having a booster. But I had covid at Christmas so Iâ€™m fully recovered
@Spain_inUK @adeibiza @wearelotuscomms Can it be a lateral flow test or does it need to be a PCR?
@BungleSkelly @adeibiza @wearelotuscomms The recovery record or certificate is valid for 180 days from the date of the positive test
@Spain_inUK Do you still need to fill in passenger locator form ?
